title: Holy Cross dedicates court to Bob Cousy
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Holy Cross dedicated its basketball court to Bob Cousy, naming it Bob Cousy '50 Court at Luth Athletic Complex.
Bob Cousy, a six-time Celtics champion, attended the dedication ceremony at Holy Cross in Worcester.
Bill Simmons and NCAA President Charlie Baker attended the event, with fans receiving purple 'Cousys' for drinks.

title: Healey proposes eliminating statute of limitations for rape when DNA evidence exists
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Gov. Maura Healey proposes removing Massachusetts 15-year statute of limitations for rape cases when a DNA match exists.
Proposal mandates evidence collection kits in sexual assault cases be stored for a minimum of 15 years.
Healey also advocates for timely testing and state database entry of DNA profiles within 30 days.

title: Watch: Patriots share hype video ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: Patriots release a hype video ahead of their Super Bowl LX match against the Seattle Seahawks.
The video features head coach Mike Vrabel discussing the team's identity and commitment.
Wide receiver Stefon Diggs is shown motivating teammates, emphasizing team unity and belief.

title: Former employee at Mass. post office pleads guilty after secretly recording female co-workers
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nicholas Testagrossa, 43, of Rindge, N.H., pleaded guilty to obstruction and voyeurism charges for secretly recording female co-workers.
Testagrossa hid cameras in a Westminster post office restroom to capture videos of female co-workers without their consent.
Testagrossa faces up to 20 years in prison for the obstruction charge, with sentencing scheduled for May 12, 2026.

title: Jewish groups sue Medford over values-based investment ordinance
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Two Jewish groups filed a federal lawsuit against Medford over its values-based investment policy citing unlawful ideological divestment.
Medford's ordinance bars investment in sectors like fossil fuels and defense, aiming to align with ethical values but faced legal pushback.
The lawsuit claims the policy violates Massachusetts investment rules prioritizing financial returns, opening possibilities for political bias.

title: Eight things Patriots must do to win Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Drake Maye must avoid turnovers against Seattle's defense for a chance at winning Super Bowl LX.
New England's defense aims to pressure Seahawks' Sam Darnold, who struggled under pressure during regular-season play.
Patriots' Christian Gonzalez to focus on neutralizing Seattle's Jaxon Smith-Njigba, the reigning NFL Offensive Player of the Year.

title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest wore No. 55 at USC, carrying on a tradition started by Junior Seau, and later brought it to the Patriots.
McGinest wore No. 55 for the Patriots from 1994-2005, becoming their second all-time sack leader and winning three Super Bowls.
Junior Seau joined the Patriots in 2006 and asked McGinest for permission to wear No. 55, highlighting mutual respect between them.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County received the highest snow totals, with Salisbury and Beverly reporting 13 inches each on February 7, 2026.
Northeastern Massachusetts experienced the most snowfall during Saturday's storm, with amounts recorded by snow observers and the National Weather Service.
Bristol County saw significant snow accumulation, including 8.2 inches in Dartmouth and 6.5 inches in Rehoboth.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC featuring the Patriots and Seahawks in Santa Clara, California.
Tirico will manage dual duties, transitioning from Super Bowl coverage to hosting NBC's Olympic studio program from Levi's Stadium.
The pregame show begins at 1 p.m. on NBC, with Maria Taylor hosting, leading up to the 6:30 p.m. game time.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots face the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, California.
Drake Maye, Patriots' quarterback, is the second-youngest to start a Super Bowl and could become the youngest winner at 23.
Seahawks' defense led the NFL in scoring and pressure rate, while the Patriots excelled in passing and blitz efficiency.
